newsitem.title: SUDAN: Sudanese group frees relief workers in south.
newsitem.headline: Sudanese group frees relief workers in south.

text.p: A south Sudanese faction has set free two relief workers it abducted in the south last month, a government newspaper said on Thursday.
The SPLA United group, led by Lam Akol, abducted relief supervisor Fikri Ardiyab and radio technician Mahjoub Abdel Rahman on September 25 between the towns of Renk and Malakal.
Both men work for the Sudanese relief organisation Humanitarian Relief Aid.
The newspaper al-Ingaz al-Watani said on Thursday they had been set free and taken to Malakal, which is under government control. It did not say when the release took place.
The U.N. World Food Programme had helped secure their release through contacts with SPLA United, a dissident splinter group from the Sudan People's Liberation Army (SPLA).
